text.tspan: Traveling Salesperson Problem (TSP)
Goal: Given a graph (V, E), find a permutation of the vertices so that each adjacent pair of vertices
(including last/first) is connected by an edge in the graph, and the sum of all lengths of edges is minimized
Def. Complete graphs on a metric space
A complete graph on V in a metric space is a graph with all possible
edges between all pairs of vertices (u, v) in V, the edges satsify
3. d(u, v) = d(v, u)
Lemma: A minimum spanning tree on a graph (V, E) has a sum
of edge lengths that does not exceed a TSP on that graph
2-Approximation of TSP on Complete Metric Graph
1) Compute an MST O(V^2 log V)
2) Pick any vertex on the MST, and do a DFS on the MST. O(V)
Claim: The order that vertices are visited in DFS gives a permutation
whose length does not exceed 2x a TSP permutation P'
prove: This length does not exceed
2x MST length
edges in tree
shortcuts
equivalent paths in MST
Considering the union of all
edges in the tree and edges along equivalent
paths, we count each MST edge exactly twice
length(P') <= length(MST)*2 <= 2*length(P)
